Breeding adult.description: Eared Grebes in breeding plumage have black necks and a fan-shaped splay of golden head feathers, whereas Horned Grebes have a chestnut neck and golden tufts that run straight back across the head.

Nonbreeding.description: Eared Grebes in nonbreeding plumage have a less clean-cut head pattern than Horned Grebes. Eared has a gray smudge behind the eye, rather than Horned's clear border between crown, cheek, and neck.

Breeding adult.description: Red-necked Grebes are larger with stouter bills than Horned Grebes. The bill is yellow and in breeding plumage Red-necked lacks the golden tufts and red eye of Horned.

Nonbreeding.description: Red-necked Grebes are larger with stouter bills than Horned Grebes. In nonbreeding plumage look for the Red-necked's yellowish bill, grayish cheek, and (at close range) dark eye.

Breeding adult.description: Pied-billed Grebes are smaller than Horned Grebes, with a short neck and thick but stubby bill. In breeding plumage they are brownish overall with a black ring on the bill.

Nonbreeding.description: In nonbreeding plumage Pied-billed Grebes can be warm brown on the neck, but at this time of year Horned Grebes are black and white. Pied-billed is smaller, shorter-necked, with a thicker, stubbier bill.
